DOC.brief_summary: Lack internet infrastructure , personal skill , service provision identify potential barrier e-health yet good evidence impact intervention improve . This study aim assess impact e-health uptake three intervention ( ) superfast broadband , ( ii ) tailor leaflet help participant improve personal internet skill support , ( iii ) GP intervention improve health service provision e-health . In cluster randomise factorial control trial , 1388 household 78 postcode randomly select 20088 Cornish postcode allocate 8 ( 2X2X2 ) arm study . Comparison ' e-health readiness ' 'miles travel ' baseline 18 month follow-up 8 arm study , use assess effect intervention , singly combination .
DOC.brief_title: Do Superfast Broadband Tailored Interventions Improve Use E-health Reduce Health Related Travel ?
DOC.criteria: 16+ member randomly select household within Cornwall Non Cornish household
